Football is the most popular sport in France, with over 1,800,000 registered players and over 18,000 registered clubs.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-495"><a href="#cite_note-495">[481]</a></sup> The football team is among the most successful in the world, with two <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> victories in 1998 and 2018,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-496"><a href="#cite_note-496">[482]</a></sup> one FIFA World Cup second place in 2006,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-497"><a href="#cite_note-497">[483]</a></sup> and two <a href="/wiki/UEFA_European_Championship" title="UEFA European Championship">UEFA European Championships</a> in <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_1984" title="UEFA Euro 1984">1984</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-498"><a href="#cite_note-498">[484]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2000" title="UEFA Euro 2000">2000</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-499"><a href="#cite_note-499">[485]</a></sup>
</p><p>The top national football club competition is <a href="/wiki/Ligue_1" title="Ligue 1">Ligue 1</a>. France has produced some of the greatest players in the world, including three-time FIFA World Player of the Year <a href="/wiki/Zinedine_Zidane" title="Zinedine Zidane">Zinedine Zidane</a>, three-time <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d'Or">Ballon d'Or</a> recipient <a href="/wiki/Michel_Platini" title="Michel Platini">Michel Platini</a>, record holder for most goals scored at a World Cup <a href="/wiki/Just_Fontaine" title="Just Fontaine">Just Fontaine</a>, first football player to receive the <a href="/wiki/Legion_of_Honour" title="Legion of Honour">Légion d'honneur</a> <a href="/wiki/Raymond_Kopa" title="Raymond Kopa">Raymond Kopa</a>, and the record goalscorer for the French national team <a href="/wiki/Thierry_Henry" title="Thierry Henry">Thierry Henry</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-500"><a href="#cite_note-500">[486]</a></sup>
</p><p>The French Open, also called Roland-Garros, is a major <a href="/wiki/Tennis" title="Tennis">tennis</a> tournament held over two weeks between late May and early June at the <a href="/wiki/Stade_Roland_Garros" title="Stade Roland Garros">Stade Roland-Garros</a> in Paris. It is the premier clay court tennis championship event in the world and the second of four annual <a href="/wiki/Grand_Slam_(tennis)" title="Grand Slam (tennis)">Grand Slam</a> tournaments.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-501"><a href="#cite_note-501">[487]</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Rugby_union" title="Rugby union">Rugby union</a> is popular, particularly in Paris and the southwest of France.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-502"><a href="#cite_note-502">[488]</a></sup> The national rugby union team has competed at every <a href="/wiki/Rugby_World_Cup" title="Rugby World Cup">Rugby World Cup</a>; it takes part in the annual <a href="/wiki/Six_Nations_Championship" title="Six Nations Championship">Six Nations Championship</a>.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1093669538">.mw-parser-output .portalbox{padding:0}.mw-parser-output .portalborder{border:solid #aaa 1px}.mw-parser-output .portalbox.tleft{margin:0.5em 1em 0.5em 0}.mw-parser-output .portalbox.tright{margin:0.5em 0 0.5em 1em}.mw-parser-output .portalbox>ul{display:table;box-sizing:border-box;max-width:175px;font-size:85%;line-height:110%;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .portalborder>ul{padding:0.1em;background:#f9f9f9}.mw-parser-output .portalbox>ul>li{display:table-row}.mw-parser-output .portalbox>ul>li>span:first-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .portalbox>ul>li>span:last-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em 0.2em 0.2em 0.3em;vertical-align:middle}</style><div aria-label="Portals" class="noprint plainlist portalbox portalborder tright" role="navigation">

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Footnotes">Footnotes</span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist reflist-upper-roman">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The current <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_France" title="Constitution of France">Constitution of France</a> does not specify a national emblem.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1"><a href="#cite_note-1">[1]</a></sup> This <a href="/wiki/Diplomatic_emblem_of_France" title="Diplomatic emblem of France">emblem</a> is used by the <a href="/wiki/President_of_France" title="President of France">President</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ministry_for_Europe_and_Foreign_Affairs" title="Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs">Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2"><a href="#cite_note-2">[2]</a></sup> and is on the cover of <a href="/wiki/French_passport" title="French passport">French passports</a>. For other symbols, see <a href="/wiki/National_symbols_of_France" title="National symbols of France">National symbols of France</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-one-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-one_4-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">For information about regional languages see <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_France" title="Languages of France">Languages of France</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-7">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> since 1993</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-three-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-three_10-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">French <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Institut_g%C3%A9ographique_national" title="Institut géographique national">National Geographic Institute</a> data, which includes bodies of water.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-four-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-four_11-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">French <a href="/wiki/Land_registration" title="Land registration">Land Register</a> data, which exclude lakes, ponds and <a href="/wiki/Glacier" title="Glacier">glaciers</a> larger than 1 km<sup>2</sup> (0.386 sq mi or 247 acres) as well as the estuaries of rivers.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-six-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-six_18-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Whole of the  except the overseas territories in the Pacific Ocean.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-seven-19"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-seven_19-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">French overseas territories in the Pacific Ocean only.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-nine-20"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-nine_20-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Time zones across the  span from UTC−10 (<a href="/wiki/French_Polynesia" title="French Polynesia">French Polynesia</a>) to UTC+12 (<a href="/wiki/Wallis_and_Futuna" title="Wallis and Futuna">Wallis and Futuna</a>).</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-eight-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-eight_22-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Daylight saving time is observed in metropolitan France and <a href="/wiki/Saint_Pierre_and_Miquelon" title="Saint Pierre and Miquelon">Saint Pierre and Miquelon</a> only.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-eleven-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-eleven_23-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The overseas regions and collectivities form part of the <a href="/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_France" title="Telephone numbers in France">French telephone numbering plan</a>, but have their own country calling codes: <a href="/wiki/Guadeloupe" title="Guadeloupe">Guadeloupe</a> +590; <a href="/wiki/Martinique" title="Martinique">Martinique</a> +596; <a href="/wiki/French_Guiana" title="French Guiana">French Guiana</a> +594; <a href="/wiki/R%C3%A9union" title="Réunion">Réunion</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mayotte" title="Mayotte">Mayotte</a> +262; <a href="/wiki/Saint_Pierre_and_Miquelon" title="Saint Pierre and Miquelon">Saint Pierre and Miquelon</a> +508. The overseas territories are not part of the French telephone numbering plan; their country calling codes are: <a href="/wiki/New_Caledonia" title="New Caledonia">New Caledonia</a> +687; <a href="/wiki/French_Polynesia" title="French Polynesia">French Polynesia</a> +689; <a href="/wiki/Wallis_and_Futuna" title="Wallis and Futuna">Wallis and Futuna</a> +681.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ten-24"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ten_24-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In addition to <a href="/wiki/.fr" title=".fr">.fr</a>, several other Internet TLDs are used in French overseas <i>départements</i> and territories: <a href="/wiki/.re" title=".re">.re</a>, <a href="/wiki/.mq" title=".mq">.mq</a>, <a href="/wiki/.gp" title=".gp">.gp</a>, <a href="/wiki/.tf" title=".tf">.tf</a>, <a href="/wiki/.nc" title=".nc">.nc</a>, <a href="/wiki/.pf" title=".pf">.pf</a>, <a href="/wiki/.wf" title=".wf">.wf</a>, <a href="/wiki/.pm" title=".pm">.pm</a>, <a href="/wiki/.gf" title=".gf">.gf</a> and <a href="/wiki/.yt" title=".yt">.yt</a>. France also uses <a href="/wiki/.eu" title=".eu">.eu</a>, shared with other members of the European Union. The <a href="/wiki/.cat" title=".cat">.cat</a> domain is used in <a href="/wiki/Catalan_Countries" title="Catalan Countries">Catalan-speaking territories</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-twelve-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-twelve_26-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/French_Guiana" title="French Guiana">French Guiana</a> is in South America; <a href="/wiki/Guadeloupe" title="Guadeloupe">Guadeloupe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Martinique" title="Martinique">Martinique</a> are in the Caribbean Sea; and <a href="/wiki/R%C3%A9union" title="Réunion">Réunion</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mayotte" title="Mayotte">Mayotte</a> are in the Indian Ocean, off the coast of Africa. All five <a href="/wiki/Administrative_divisions_of_France" title="Administrative divisions of France">are considered integral parts of the French Republic</a>. France also comprises <a href="/wiki/Saint_Pierre_and_Miquelon" title="Saint Pierre and Miquelon">Saint Pierre and Miquelon</a> in North America; <a href="/wiki/Saint_Barth%C3%A9lemy" title="Saint Barthélemy">Saint Barthélemy</a> and <a href="/wiki/Saint_Martin_(island)" title="Saint Martin (island)">Saint Martin</a> in the Caribbean; <a href="/wiki/French_Polynesia" title="French Polynesia">French Polynesia</a>, <a href="/wiki/New_Caledonia" title="New Caledonia">New Caledonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wallis_and_Futuna" title="Wallis and Futuna">Wallis and Futuna</a> and <a href="/wiki/Clipperton_Island" title="Clipperton Island">Clipperton Island</a> in the Pacific Ocean; and the <a href="/wiki/French_Southern_and_Antarctic_Lands" title="French Southern and Antarctic Lands">French Southern and Antarctic Lands</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-303"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-303">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">INSEE definition: an immigrant is a person born in a foreign country not having French citizenship at birth. Note that an immigrant may have acquired French citizenship since moving to France, but is still considered an immigrant in French statistics. On the other hand, persons born in France with foreign citizenship (the children of immigrants) are not listed as immigrants. Changes in immigrant numbers result from: arrivals of new immigrants - (departures + deaths in France).</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-330"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-330">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The last <i>sacre</i> was that of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Charles_X_of_France" title="Charles X of France">Charles X</a>, 29 May 1825.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-14">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.insee.fr/en/statistiques/serie/000436387" rel="nofollow">"Demography – Population at the beginning of the month – Metropolitan France"</a>. <i>insee.fr</i>. 28 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-IMFWEOFR-15"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-IMFWEOFR_15-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IMFWEOFR_15-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IMFWEOFR_15-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IMFWEOFR_15-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/WEO/weo-database/2021/October/weo-report?c=132,&amp;s=NGDP_RPCH,NGDPD,PPPGDP,NGDPDPC,PPPPC,&amp;sy=2016&amp;ey=2026&amp;ssm=0&amp;scsm=1&amp;scc=0&amp;ssd=1&amp;ssc=0&amp;sic=0&amp;sort=country&amp;ds=.&amp;br=1" rel="nofollow">"World Economic Outlook Database, October 2021"</a>. <i>imf.org</i>. </li>

<li id="cite_note-30"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-30">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://piketty.pse.ens.fr/fichiers/enseig/ecoineg/EcoIneg_fichiers/DaviesShorrocks2010(CSGlobalWealthReport).pdf" rel="nofollow">"Global Wealth Report"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Credit Suisse. October 2010. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20141109055804/http://piketty.pse.ens.fr/fichiers/enseig/ecoineg/EcoIneg_fichiers/DaviesShorrocks2010%28CSGlobalWealthReport%29.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 9 November 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 October</span> 2014</span>. <q>"In euro and USD terms, the total wealth of French households is very sizeable. Although it has just 1% of the world's adults, France ranks fourth among nations in aggregate household wealth – behind China and just ahead of Germany. Europe as a whole accounts for 35% of the individuals in the global top 1%, but France itself contributes a quarter of the European contingent.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Global+Wealth+Report&amp;rft.pub=Credit+Suisse&amp;rft.date=2010-10&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fpiketty.pse.ens.fr%2Ffichiers%2Fenseig%2Fecoineg%2FEcoIneg_fichiers%2FDaviesShorrocks2010%28CSGlobalWealthReport%29.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-39"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-39">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFWells2008">Wells, John C. (2008). <i>Longman Pronunciation Dictionary</i> (3rd ed.). Longman. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4058-8118-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4058-8118-0"><bdi>978-1-4058-8118-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Longman+Pronunciation+Dictionary&amp;rft.edition=3rd&amp;rft.pub=Longman&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4058-8118-0&amp;rft.aulast=Wells&amp;rft.aufirst=John+C.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span>; <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCollinsMees1990">Collins, Beverley; Mees, Inger M. (1990). "The Phonetics of Cardiff English". <li id="cite_note-63"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-63">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFTempleman1952"><a href="/wiki/Geoffrey_Templeman" title="Geoffrey Templeman">Templeman, Geoffrey</a> (1952). <li id="cite_note-81"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-81">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Noir sur Blanc: Les premières photos du camp de concentration

<li id="cite_note-125"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-125">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190819171349/https://www.parcs-naturels-regionaux.fr/les-parcs-naturels-regionaux-de-france/decouvrir-les-54-parcs" rel="nofollow">"Découvrir les 54 Parcs"</a>. <i>Fédération des Parcs naturels régionaux de France</i>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-143"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-143">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In European countries, legal doctrine has long faced the question of succession of criminal laws in time: <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFBuonomo2015">Buonomo, Giampiero (2015). <li id="cite_note-177"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-177">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFThierry_Gadault2002">Thierry Gadault (13 June 2002). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120311161443/http://lexpansion.lexpress.fr/entreprise/la-france-demeure-un-fournisseur-d-armes-de-premier-plan_95084.html" rel="nofollow">"La France demeure un fournisseur d'armes de premier plan"</a> [France stays one of the biggest arms supplier]]. <i>L'express</i> (in French). [In 2001, France sold $1,288 billion of military equipment, ranking 3rd in the world for arms exportations behind the USA and Russia</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=L%27express&amp;rft.atitle=La+France+demeure+un+fournisseur+d%27armes+de+premier+plan&amp;rft.date=2002-06-13&amp;rft.au=Thierry+Gadault&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Flexpansion.lexpress.fr%2Fentreprise%2Fla-france-demeure-un-fournisseur-d-armes-de-premier-plan_95084.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-178"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-178">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://www.20minutes.fr/economie/551139-20100208-economie-les-ventes-d-armes-explosent-en-2009" rel="nofollow">"Les ventes d'armes explosent en 2009"</a> [Sales of weapons explode in 2009]. <i>20 minutes</i> (in French). 8 February 2010<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">6 January</span> 2017</span>. <q>La France est au 4ème rang mondial des exportateurs d'armes, derrière les Etats-Unis, le Royaume-Uni et la Russie, et devant Israël, selon un rapport du ministère de la Défense publié l'an dernier. [France is 4th biggest arms exporter, behind the United States, the United Kingdom and Russia, and ahead of Israel, according to a report of the Ministry of Defense published a year ago.]</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=20+minutes&amp;rft.atitle=Les+ventes+d%27armes+explosent+en+2009&amp;rft.date=2010-02-08&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.20minutes.fr%2Feconomie%2F551139-20100208-economie-les-ventes-d-armes-explosent-en-2009&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-212"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-212">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/france_159/economy_6815/overview-of-the-french-economy_6831/key-figures-of-the-french-economy_1402.html#sommaire_1" rel="nofollow">"Key figures of the French economy"</a>. <i>France Diplomatie</i>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Minister_of_Foreign_Affairs_(France)" title="Minister of Foreign Affairs (France)">French Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20100114024542/http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/france_159/economy_6815/overview-of-the-french-economy_6831/key-figures-of-the-french-economy_1402.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 14 January 2010. <q>France is the world's fifth largest exporter of goods (mainly durables). The country ranks fourth in services and third in agriculture (especially in cereals and the agri-food sector). It is the leading producer and exporter of farm products in Europe.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=France+Diplomatie&amp;rft.atitle=Key+figures+of+the+French+economy&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.diplomatie.gouv.fr%2Fen%2Ffrance_159%2Feconomy_6815%2Foverview-of-the-french-economy_6831%2Fkey-figures-of-the-french-economy_1402.html%23sommaire_1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-223"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-223">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20071224180811/http://www2.culture.gouv.fr/deps/mini_chiff_03/fr/musee.htm" rel="nofollow">"Fréquentation des musées et des bâtiments historiques"</a> [Frequentation of museums and historic buildings] (in French). 2003. <li id="cite_note-299"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-299">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFRichburg2005">Richburg, Keith B. <li id="cite_note-300"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-300">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFSachs2007">Sachs, Susan (12 January 2007). <a class="external text" href="http://www.csmonitor.com/2007/0112/p01s04-woeu.html" rel="nofollow">"In officially colorblind France, blacks have a dream – and now a lobby"</a>. <i>The Christian Science Monitor</i>. <li id="cite_note-383"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-383">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="languageicon">(in French)</span> Claude Lébedel – Les Splendeurs du Baroque en France: <i>Histoire et splendeurs du baroque en France</i> page 9: "Si en allant plus loin, on prononce les mots 'art baroque en France', on provoque alors le plus souvent une moue interrogative, parfois seulement étonnée, parfois franchement réprobatrice: Mais voyons, l'art baroque n'existe pas en France!"</span>

<li id="cite_note-414"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-414">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="http://www.hmv.co.jp/news/newsDetail.asp?newsnum=304080038" rel="nofollow">"100人の偉大なアーティスト - No. 62"</a> [The 100 Greatest Artists – No. 62]. <i>ローチケHMV [Roachke HMV]</i> (in Japanese). 21 April 2003.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%81%E3%82%B1HMV+%5BRoachke+HMV%5D&amp;rft.atitle=100%E4%BA%BA%E3%81%AE%E5%81%89%E5%A4%A7%E3%81%AA%E3%82%A2%E3%83%BC%E3%83%86%E3%82%A3%E3%82%B9%E3%83%88+-+No.+62&amp;rft.date=2003-04-21&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.hmv.co.jp%2Fnews%2FnewsDetail.asp%3Fnewsnum%3D304080038&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-415"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-415">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160430102257/http://www.rfimusic.com/artist/rock/noir-desir/biography" rel="nofollow">"Biography of Noir Désir"</a>. <i>rfi Music</i>. <a href="/wiki/Radio_France_Internationale" title="Radio France Internationale">RFI</a> Musique. December 2010. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.rfimusic.com/artist/rock/noir-desir/biography" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 30 April 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">11 January</span> 2018</span>. <q>Rock music doesn't come naturally to the French. A Latin country, with more affinity to poetry and melody, France has very rarely produced talented rock musicians. Rock music has other, more Anglo-Saxon ingredients: fury, excess, electricity.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=rfi+Music&amp;rft.atitle=Biography+of+Noir+D%C3%A9sir&amp;rft.date=2010-12&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.rfimusic.com%2Fartist%2Frock%2Fnoir-desir%2Fbiography&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-frmusic-416"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-frmusic_416-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-frmusic_416-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-frmusic_416-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20101222105333/http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/france_159/culture-and-media_6819/culture_6874/music_5335/french-music-has-the-whole-planet-singing_13031.html" rel="nofollow">"French music has the whole planet singing"</a>. <i>France Diplomatie</i>. 22 June 2009. <li id="cite_note-418"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-418">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFBernadette_McNulty2007">Bernadette McNulty (17 November 2007). <span class="cs1-lock-subscription" title="Paid subscription required"><a class="external text" href="https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/3669339/Daft-Punk-Behind-the-robot-masks.html" rel="nofollow">"Daft Punk: Behind the robot masks"</a></span>. <i>The Telegraph</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20220110/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/3669339/Daft-Punk-Behind-the-robot-masks.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 10 January 2022. <q>Daft Punk were in many ways responsible for turning the spotlight on a new, cool underground of French music in the late 1990s, including bestselling acts such as Air, and have been a huge influence on the current generation of international star DJs.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Telegraph&amp;rft.atitle=Daft+Punk%3A+Behind+the+robot+masks&amp;rft.date=2007-11-17&amp;rft.au=Bernadette+McNulty&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.telegraph.co.uk%2Fculture%2Fmusic%2F3669339%2FDaft-Punk-Behind-the-robot-masks.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-428"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-428">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFUIS">UIS. <a class="external text" href="http://data.uis.unesco.org/?ReportId=5538" rel="nofollow">"UIS Statistics"</a>. UNESCO.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=UIS+Statistics&amp;rft.pub=UNESCO&amp;rft.au=UIS&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fdata.uis.unesco.org%2F%3FReportId%3D5538&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-501"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-501">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFClarey2001">Clarey, Christopher (30 June 2001). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20071016123550/http://iht.com/articles/2001/06/30/a20_16.php" rel="nofollow">"Change Seems Essential to Escape Extinction: Wimbledon: World's Most Loved Dinosaur"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/International_Herald_Tribune" title="International Herald Tribune">International Herald Tribune</a></i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.iht.com/articles/2001/06/30/a20_16.php" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 16 October 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">26 February</span> 2018</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Herald+Tribune&amp;rft.atitle=Change+Seems+Essential+to+Escape+Extinction%3A+Wimbledon%3A+World%27s+Most+Loved+Dinosaur&amp;rft.date=2001-06-30&amp;rft.aulast=Clarey&amp;rft.aufirst=Christopher&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.iht.com%2Farticles%2F2001%2F06%2F30%2Fa20_16.php&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AFrance"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-502"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-502">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090615002946/http://www.123voyage.com/realsw/tosee/rugby.htm" rel="nofollow">Rugby</a>. 123 Voyage</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<ul><li>"France." in <i>Europe,</i> edited by Ferdie McDonald and Claire Marsden, Dorling Kindersley (Gale, 2010), pp. 144–217. <a class="external text" href="https://link.gale.com/apps/doc/CX1644200020/GPS?u=wikipedia&amp;sid=GPS&amp;xid=3062efe1" rel="nofollow">online</a></li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Topics">Topics</span></h3>
<ul><li>Carls, Alice-Catherine. "France." in <i>World Press Encyclopedia,</i> edited by Amanda C. Quick, (2nd ed., vol. 1, Gale, 2003), pp. 314–337. <a class="external text" href="https://link.gale.com/apps/doc/CX3409900079/GPS?u=wikipedia&amp;sid=GPS&amp;xid=59dd8c94" rel="nofollow">online coverage of press and media</a></li>
<li>Chabal, Emile, ed. <i>France since the 1970s: History, Politics and Memory in an Age of Uncertainty</i> (2015) <a class="external text" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/1472509773" rel="nofollow">Excerpt</a></li>
<li>Gildea, Robert. <i>France Since 1945</i> (2nd ed. Oxford University Press, 2002).</li>
<li>Goodliffe, Gabriel, and Riccardo Brizzi, eds. <i>France After 2012</i> (Bergham, 2015)</li>
<li>Haine, W. S. <i>Culture and Customs of France</i> (Greenwood Press, 2006).</li>
<li>Kelly, Michael, ed. <i>French Culture and Society: The Essentials</i> (Oxford University Press, 2001).</li>
<li>Raymond, Gino. <i>Historical Dictionary of France</i> (2nd ed. Scarecrow, 2008).</li>
<li>Jones, Colin. Cambridge Illustrated History of France (Cambridge University Press, 1999)</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://merhav.nli.org.il/primo-explore/search?query=any,contains,france%20%20maps&amp;tab=default_tab&amp;search_scope=Local&amp;sortby=lso01&amp;vid=NLI&amp;mfacet=tlevel,include,online_resources,1&amp;mfacet=rtype,include,Maps,1&amp;mfacet=topic,include,France,1&amp;lang=en_US&amp;offset=0&amp;came_from=sort" rel="nofollow">Ancient maps</a> of France from the Eran Laor Cartographic Collection, The <a href="/wiki/National_Library_of_Israel" title="National Library of Israel">National Library of Israel</a></li></ul>

<td style="width:33%">Atlantic Ocean</td>
<td style="width:33%;">
<div style="white-space:nowrap;"><img alt="" data-file-height="500" data-file-width="600" decoding="async" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Pfeil_links.svg/17px-Pfeil_links.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Pfeil_links.svg/25px-Pfeil_links.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Pfeil_links.svg/34px-Pfeil_links.svg.png 2x" style="vertical-align: middle" title="West" width="17"/><b style="display:inline-block; vertical-align:middle; margin:0.75em 1em"><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/35px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/45px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" width="23"/> </span>France</b><img alt="" data-file-height="500" data-file-width="600" decoding="async" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Pfeil_rechts.svg/17px-Pfeil_rechts.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Pfeil_rechts.svg/25px-Pfeil_rechts.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Pfeil_rechts.svg/34px-Pfeil_rechts.svg.png 2x" style="vertical-align: middle" title="East" width="17"/></div>
</td>
<td style="width:33%"><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1000" decoding="async" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/23px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/35px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/46px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 2x" width="23"/> </span>Germany<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="512" data-file-width="512" decoding="async" height="16" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Flag_of_Switzerland.svg/16px-Flag_of_Switzerland.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Flag_of_Switzerland.svg/24px-Flag_of_Switzerland.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Flag_of_Switzerland.svg/32px-Flag_of_Switzerland.svg.png 2x" width="16"/>  </span>Switzerland<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1000" data-file-width="1500" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/23px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/35px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/45px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 2x" width="23"/> </span>Italy</td>

</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3"><div><div class="hlist hlist-separated"><ul><li><sup>1</sup> Spans the conventional boundary between Europe and another continent.</li><li><sup>2</sup> Considered European for cultural, political and historical reasons but is geographically in Western Asia.</li><li><sup>3</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li></ul></div>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Members_of_the_European_Economic_Area_(EEA)" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="3" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:European_Economic_Area_(EEA)" title="Template:European Economic Area (EEA)"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:European_Economic_Area_(EEA)" title="Template talk:European Economic Area (EEA)"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:European_Economic_Area_(EEA)&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Members_of_the_European_Economic_Area_(EEA)" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">Members of the <a href="/wiki/European_Economic_Area" title="European Economic Area">European Economic Area (EEA)</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/European_Free_Trade_Association#Membership" title="European Free Trade Association">EFTA member states</a></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Iceland" title="Iceland">Iceland</a> <small>(<a href="/wiki/Iceland%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="Iceland–European Union relations">EU relations</a>)</small></li>

</div></td><td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="2" style="width:1px;padding:0 0 0 2px"><div><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg"><img alt="Agreement on the European Economic Area.svg" data-file-height="610" data-file-width="610" decoding="async" height="80" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg/80px-Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg/120px-Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg/160px-Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg.png 2x" width="80"/></a></div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Member_state_of_the_European_Union" title="Member state of the European Union">EU member states</a></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<h2>Navigation menu</h2>
<div id="mw-head">
<nav aria-labelledby="p-personal-label" class="vector-menu mw-portlet mw-portlet-personal vector-user-menu-legacy" id="p-personal" role="navigation">
<h3 class="vector-menu-heading" id="p-personal-label">
<span class="vector-menu-heading-label">Personal tools</span>
</h3>
<div class="vector-menu-content">
